image.altText: A newspaper lies open with a story on one side headlined "Baby alone in murder house" and a picture of a boy.

props.synopsis: The case struck at the heart of Melbourne. Almost half a century later, it's yet to reach a conclusion.

title.children: The Easey Street killings became Victoria's most serious and longest running cold case, and it's not over yet

image.altText: Lions players leap into a big group hug in celebration

props.synopsis: Brisbane will face Sydney in the 2024 AFL grand final after the Lions stood up in the final moments to win a classic preliminary final against Geelong.

title.children: Lions never stop believing to edge Cats in preliminary final for the ages

image.altText: Greta Bodey of Hawthorn reacts after kicking a goal during the AFLW

props.synopsis: Hawthorn, Fremantle and Geelong have picked up important wins on Saturday in round four of the AFLW.

title.children: Bodey kicks six in big Hawks win, Freo kick goal after siren to sink Dees

image.altText: Alison Donnan holds up a bit of Tupperware.

props.synopsis: Tupperware's plastic may be famously indestructible, but the US-based company filed for bankruptcy this week. It's cause for reflection from the Australians who sold the containers to party-goers across decades.

title.children: As Tupperware files for bankruptcy, the memories live on for the Australians who sold the famous plastic

image.altText: John Pesutto and Moira Deeming in a composite image.

props.synopsis: Moira Deeming took the stand in the first week of the defamation case brought against her former boss, Victorian Liberal leader John Pesutto.

title.children: How a secret recording launched a meeting between senior Victorian Liberals and a rookie MP into the public sphere

image.altText: Rocco standing in front of a neon sign reading 'Pellegrini's' with his arms folded.

props.synopsis: Rocco Eliche will hang up his apron for the last time today after 50 years at the iconic Melbourne coffee bar Pellegrini's.

title.children: 'Moustache and a big smile': Pellegrini's in Melbourne farewells long-term server Rocco Eliche

image.altText: Portrait of Australian soldier, Sergeant Sam Pearse, in uniform and slouch hat around WW I

props.synopsis: The Australian government says it is not responsible for identifying the remains, thought to be of Victoria Cross recipient Samuel Pearse, which have been sitting in a plastic box in a Russian morgue for five years.

title.children: Grandson seeks fast-track DNA test on 100yo remains in Russia thought to be war hero grandfather

image.altText: A composite of three photos. The Great Stupa white building with gold dome, a man posing in the Big Wave, Cape Clear lighthouse.

props.synopsis: When planning a road trip, the journey can be just as important as the destination, so look out for these impressive landmarks across Victoria.

title.children: Taking a road trip? Don't miss out on these five quirky rest stops

image.altText: A man and woman hug next to police tape at Daylesford after a fatal crash.

props.synopsis: Five people died when the car of diabetic William Swale crashed into an outdoor eating area when he had a hypoglycaemic episode.

title.children: Daylesford pub crash driver William Swale's 'hypo' led to all charges being dropped. So what is a 'hypo'?

image.altText: A vintage-style illustration of two boxers fighting in a ring, surrounded by a crowd

props.synopsis: The past 12 years have delivered a spectacular meteor shower of defamation cases brought by celebrities, politicians and businessfolk, and fought out on the national stage of the Federal Court. ABC Long Reads has the story of how it all began.

title.children: Multimillion-dollar celebrity court cases have boomed — but sometimes they have a nasty habit of backfiring

image.altText: A thumbnail composite of Wills Property's listing and complaints they received and their response.

props.synopsis: After a three-bedroom inner-Sydney apartment went viral for its strict conditions for tenants, the internet came hard for the agency behind it. In response, that same business has begun posting personal details of their critics in a move to stop the posts.

title.children: The internet rallied against a real estate agency. It responded by posting their critics' personal information

image.altText: A restaurant is packed with people eating food in a brightly-lit setting

props.synopsis: The South Korean cultural phenomenon shows no signs of slowing as Melbourne announces its official Koreatown.

title.children: How Australia's newest K-town reflects the growing influence of Korea's culture on our cities

image.altText: Phillip Mehrtens sitting in a chair after being freed. He has long hair and a beard.

props.synopsis: Armed pro-independence rebels in Indonesia's Papua region have released New Zealand man Philip Mehrtens after holding him hostage for more than 19 months.

title.children: NZ pilot freed after being held hostage by armed rebels in Indonesia's Papua region for 19 months

image.altText: a group of men look at a BYD car in front of a BYD logo

props.synopsis: Despite tariffs and a slowing global demand for electric vehicles in recent months, China is steaming ahead with its transition to EVs.

title.children: 'The Chinese offensive is visible everywhere': The changing face of the auto industry

image.altText: A drone shot of a 3D printed neighbourhood in Texas

props.synopsis: Texas just opened its biggest 3D-printed neighbourhood as a solution to its acute housing problem. Could it be the solution the Australian construction has been waiting for?

title.children: A four-tonne machine just printed a house in the US. What can Australia learn?

image.altText: Saline 1

props.synopsis: One senior clinician at a major Sydney hospital has described the ongoing situation as "a complete sh**show".

title.children: 'You're being asked to act as a gatekeeper': Doctors say they are still being forced to conserve IV fluids

image.altText: A person looks inside a building with rubble strewn throughout it

props.synopsis: It comes as the Lebanese health ministry raises the death toll from an Israeli strike on Beirut's suburbs to at least 37, including three children and seven women.

title.children: Gaza officials say at least 22 people killed in Israeli strike on school

image.altText: A woman with a neutral expression looks at the camera. In the background, medical equipment is visible.

props.synopsis: Sholbaana Kuular and her family have firsthand experience with regard to how racist Russian society can be, but a proposed new law that would limit the number of migrant children in classrooms has outlined how discrimination often starts at state level.

title.children: Inside the 'horrible machine' of Russian racism, where bullying starts at state level

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Four teenagers have been arrested after allegedly threatening a man in a Melbourne shopping centre car park with a pair of pliers and pulling him out of his vehicle.

title.children: Teenagers as young as 14 arrested after allegedly threatening man with pliers and stealing his car

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Joe Biden shake hands in a garden surrounded by lush greenery.

props.synopsis: The US president welcomed the prime minister to his property in Wilmington, Delaware, for what could be the last official one-on-one meeting between the leaders.

title.children: Albanese visits Biden's home ahead of Quad talks on 'aggressive' actions from China

image.altText: A man waves Sri Lanka's flag during a campaign rally at night.

props.synopsis: Two years since thousands of protesters swarmed the presidential palace in Sri Lanka, voters are heading to the polls, where three presidential candidates have emerged as frontrunners for the first time.

title.children: After Nixon's protests, the Sri Lankan president fled. Who will he vote for at tomorrow's election?

image.altText: Half of a white metal hull with debris around it lies on the ocean floor, with blue water and harsh light

props.synopsis: The catastrophic implosion of the Titan submersible deep in the waters of the Atlantic Ocean in 2023 could have been prevented, a hearing into the tragedy has been told.

title.children: Former OceanGate employees reveal they knew the Titan submersible was unsafe before implosion

image.altText: Side by side photos of Anthony Albanese and Adam Bandt, both in dark suits, ties and spectacles

props.synopsis: Australia's housing crisis is a perfect storm of issues that requires a reset of the housing debate which so far has not been able to happen in the poisonous political competition of 2024.

title.children: Fixing Australia's housing crisis requires a reset of the poisonous debate that's clogged up politics

image.altText: A hand holding a phone displaying a map

props.synopsis: Since the start of the Gaza war, Israel has been deploying a tactic known as GPS "spoofing", which is designed to fool enemy missiles but has also had detrimental impacts on civilian life.

title.children: In the Middle East, dating apps, food delivery and map navigation are leading everyone to Beirut Airport

image.altText: A family inside a small house

props.synopsis: Joanne Fourmile has been waiting for housing for eight years, raising children and undergoing breast cancer treatment while sleeping on a mattress on her cousin's living room floor.

title.children: Families plead for action on overcrowding in remote community with up to 25 people to a home

image.altText: Rupert Murdoch helped out of the back seat of a car by his wife and a security guard

props.synopsis: If the latest instalment in the Murdoch family saga tells us anything, it is that while the patriarch no longer jokes about immortality, he's at least retained his dark sense of humour.

title.children: War of the words breaks out over Rupert's desperate bid to control beyond the grave

image.altText: A photo of Travis King in army uniform, standing in front of an American flag. He is a black man  in his 20s with dark eyes.

props.synopsis: With time already served and credit for good behaviour, the US Army soldier was released, his lawyer says.

title.children: US soldier who fled to North Korea now free after pleading guilty to desertion

image.altText: Donald Trump is shielded by secret service as blood spreads from an injury on his ear

props.synopsis: A report reveals numerous "deficiencies" in the security preparations ahead of Trump's attempted assassination, in the most formal attempt by the Secret Service to catalogue its errors of the day.

title.children: Secret Service report details litany of communication failures preceding July assassination attempt on Donald Trump

image.altText: Jenny Adams, in black shirt with brown hair, smiles widely next to man in white shirt, whose hand she holds. He also smiles.

props.synopsis: Ever wanted to try sleeping apart from your partner but feared the judgement of others or perhaps your partner's reaction? These people have not only tried it but love it. Here's how they make it work.

title.children: Sleeping apart made these couples happier and their relationships better. Could it work for you?

image.altText: An older woman with short white hair sits on a chair in a clothing store. Her expression is neutral.

props.synopsis: Pensioner Raelene Cowan has little money left over after buying food and paying the bills. But she still treats herself to a new outfit, with the help of Thread Together, a program that's saving unwanted clothing destined for landfill.

title.children: 'Everyone deserves to feel good': New clothes diverted from landfill to people in need amid cost of living crisis

image.altText: A man with his face blurred, being approached by four immigration officials.

props.synopsis: Queensland Police allege the 62-year-old man was facing sexual offences but failed to appear in a Brisbane court in 2021.

title.children: Man charged with historical sexual offences extradited to Queensland after being deported from Thailand

image.altText: Amanda Stoker looks to her side while attending a parliamentary committee

props.synopsis: An LNP candidate has withdrawn her support for a rabbi who repeatedly compared homosexuality to paedophilia, bestiality, and incest.

title.children: LNP candidate pleads ignorance after pulling support for rabbi with 'extreme' anti-homosexual views

image.altText: Two men celebrate winning a rugby league match

props.synopsis: After their recent finals fade-outs it didn't matter how the Sharks downed the Cowboys on Friday night, it just mattered that they did.

title.children: Function trumps form as Cronulla end their lengthy finals losing streak

image.altText: Two dolphins vertical in the water with their head sticking out, touching flippers.

props.synopsis: Despite forced copulation being common in nature, females of some species have evolved ways that give them ultimate control over who fertilises her eggs.

title.children: The weird ways female animals evolved ways to pick the father of their babies
